title: Impetuous Youth
description: When you make a move and come up short, you can give it your all and turn a ≤6 into a 7-9, a 7-9 into a 10+, and (if it matterns) a 10-11 into a 12+. But if you do, pick 1 (the GM will fill in the details):

bullets: You get hurt (2d4 damage and an actual injury)
You cause collateral damage, endanger others, or otherwise escalate the situation
Something on your person is lost or breaks

title: Driven
description: Choose one, you always have the option of Burning Bright; you can spend 2 XP after you roll to add +1, even if you don't have enough XP to level.
pickOne: A loved one was killed or abducted
Someone gave their life to save you
Your idol sacrificed themselves to save many
You stumbled upon a dark mystery
You must make amends for a terrible mistake

title: Destined (Start of Session + Omens)
description: Fate has laid her hand upon you.  Choose 3-4 of the items below to describe your destiny.  When you are at Death's Door, ask yourself, "Is my destiny fulfilled?" If it is not, treat a miss as a 7-9 and a 7-9 as a 10+.  At start of session role +Omens

outcomes.text: Loose all Omens and the GM will describe a dream, vision, or portent that points towards your fate.  Ask the GM a follow-up question and get a clear, helpful answer.
As above but no follow-up question
Don't mark XP, hold +1 Omen, and tell us of the nightmares you have breen having and how your fears play into them.

title: Pick 2
pick: A heap of expectations: of little use
Husbandry tools: brushes, muzzles, collars, feed, ◇ whips, ◇ bridles, etc.  Gain advantage to Persuade domestic beasts (livestock, dogs, etc)
Stoneworker's tools: chisels, drills, ◇ prybars, ◇ spikes, ◇ block & tackles, wheelbarrow, etc.
Tannery (or access to it): lime, acid, salts, thick gloves, ◇ a boilrd leather cuirass (1 Armor), etc.
Personal token, fraught with meaning (tick move below)

title: Personal Token
pick: A wool cloak, woven for you by ____
A letter, spattered with tears & blood
A flute, a gift from someone you loved
A fine locket, holding a strand of hair

title: Fear
description: What do you fear most? (choose 1, maybe 2)
pick: Fire, burning, the smell of charred flesh
That they won't take you seriously
That you really aren't cut out for this
The death of your family or loved ones

title: Anger
description: What makes you burn with righteous anger? (choose 2, maybe 3)
pick: The despoiling of beauty and innocence
Violence to children, animals, the innocent

title: Anger is a Gift
description: When you burn with righteous anger (Fear & Anger - above), hold 2 Resolve. You can spend your Resolve 1-for-1 to:

bullets: Set aside fear and doubt to do what must be done
Inspire allies or bystanders to follow your lead
Keep your footing, position, and/or your course despite what befalls you

title: Speak Truth to Power (Requires Anger is a Gift)
description: When you demand that someone does what is clearly good and right, you have advantage to Persuade.

title: Better Part of Valor
description: When you are outnumbered or facing a foe bigger than you, you have advantage to hide from, escape from, or sneak past them.

title: I Get Knocked Down
description: When you take damage despite your best efforts to avoid it, you can choose to halve the damage but pick 1 of the following:

outcomes.text: Whatever you choose, the GM will describe the details.
bullets: You're out of it for a moment

title: But I Get Up Again (Requires I Get Knocked Down)
description: When you use I Get Knocked Down, you have advantage on your next roll against whatever dealt the damage.

outcomes.text: Your next blow against them does +1d4 damage.

title: In Over Your Head
description: When another PC rescues you from danger, mark XP.

title: Inquiring Minds
description: When you seek out and receive honest advice, gain advantage on your next roll to follow that advice.

title: Iron Will
description: When you are subject to mind control or magic that affects your feelings, you can take 1d4 damage (ignoring armor) to disregard its influence.

title: Never Gonna Keep Me Down
description: When you have 5 or fewer current HP, you impose disadvantage on any damage you take.

outcomes.text: Once per session, when you are at Death's Door, don't roll. You get a 10+.

title: Potential for Greatness
description: (Requires the Would-Be Hero) Once per level, when you roll a stat and get a 10+, mark one of the options on your Potential for Greatness card. You don't have to mark them in order

title: Resourceful
description: When you Defy Danger and roll a 6-, ask the GM a question from Seek Insight after they describe what happens.

outcomes.text: Gain advantage on your next roll to act on the answer.

title: Something to Remember Me By
description: When you spend Readiness (from Defend) to strike back at an attacker, you deal +1d4 damage.

outcomes.text: You also scar, mark, or diminish them in some way (the GM will say how, or ask you to).

title: Tough Love
description: When you honestly think another PC is in the wrong and call them on it, they have disadvantage on any rolls against you until you two work it out.

title: Underestimated
description: As long as you avoid overt hostility, no enemy will consider you a threat.

outcomes.text: When you first make your move against an enemy who underestimates you, you have advantage.

title: Up With People
description: When you converse with someone (PC or NPC) you can hold 2 Rapport with them. If you do, they hold 1 Rapport with you. During the conversation, either of you can spend 1 Rapport to ask the other player one of the following and get an honest answer.

bullets: What weighs you down or holds you back?
What lesson would you have me learn?
What do you think of me, truly?

title: Versatile (Requires level 2+, the Would-be Hero)
description: Choose a move from any other playbook, as long as you meet its requirements. You can pick from a different playbook each time. You can't take Improved Stat or Superior Stat.

title: A Force to be Reckoned With (Requires level 6+; replaces Underestimated)
description: Any intelligent creature who looks you in the eye or hears the steel in your voice instinctively knows that you are a force to be reckoned with, and treats you appropriately.

outcomes.text: When you Defy Danger against something trying to harm or constrain you, on a 12+ you turn the tables on them (the GM will say how, or ask you to).

title: Big Damn Hero (Requires level 6+; replaces In Over Your Head)
description: When you first leap into danger to protect someone, don't roll to Defend. Instead, treat it as though you rolled a 10+.

outcomes.text: When you Defend, you can spend 1 Readiness to lock eyes with an attacker; they have disadvantage on damage rolls against you and your ward for the rest of the fight.

title: Superior Stat (Requires all 6 marks in Potential for Greatness)
description: Increase one of your stats by +1 (to a max of +3).

title: Undaunted (Requires level 6+; replaces Better Part of Valor)
description: When you are outnumbered or facing a foe bigger than you, you get +1 armor and deal +1d6 damage.

title: Voice of Experience (Requires level 6+; replaces Inquiring Minds)
description: When another PC comes to you for advice and you tell them what you think is best, they have advantage on their first roll to follow your advice.

outcomes.text: When you Seek Insight, you can always ask, 'What is about to happen?' for free, even on a 6-.
